news_header: Fadoul Saleh, a 73-year-old nomadic shepherd in Chad, faces devastating losses due to extreme weather, including drought and floods, which have wiped out his livestock and disrupted his way of life.
news_text: Fadoul Saleh, a 73-year-old nomadic shepherd in Chad, has experienced severe hardships due to climate change, losing 70 cows to drought and 35 to floods in a single year. The floods, which have affected over 1.9 million people in Chad, have devastated his livelihood, leaving him with no means to survive. Saleh highlights the increasing scarcity of water and pasture, leading to conflicts with farmers and competition for resources. He expresses concern over the impact of wealthy herders on their traditional way of life and the lack of support from authorities. Many herders like Saleh are struggling to adapt to the changing environment and uncertain future.
